hook.text: Elizabeth Holmes raised $700 million for blood-testing technology that never actually worked.

buildup.text: Holmes negotiated partnerships with Walgreens and Safeway, securing billions in commitments on promises alone.

discovery.text: Theranos couldn't perform the tests it claimed. Internal whistleblowers were silenced and threatened.

twist.text: Holmes was convicted of fraud. Partners lost hundreds of millions. Patients received unreliable health results.

climax.text: Negotiating commitments for a product that doesn't exist isn't visionary â€” it's fraud.

punchline.text: You can negotiate anything. But you can only deliver what's real.

quiz.question: What was the fundamental problem with Theranos's negotiations?
options: They secured commitments for technology that never actually worked
